com.yantra.api.wms.count

Interface acceptVariance

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface acceptVariance

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document acceptVariance(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      acceptVariance accepts variance and adjusts the system inventory based on variance detected during the count process.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptVariance

        org.w3c.dom.Document acceptVariance(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        acceptVariance accepts variance and adjusts the system inventory based on variance detected during the count process. Variance will be accepted and inventory adjusted only for the latest summary task results for a count request. Variance acceptance must be performed against a valid inventory adjustment reason code. For accepting variance for a multi-enterprise count request, one must configure the inventory adjustment reason code for all the enterprises. These reason codes can map to different accounting bins.

        Logic for variance acceptance:

        • If count result(s) is/are at item level, inventory adjustment(s) will be performed against the accounting bin(s) of the variance acceptance reason code.
        • If the count result(s) is/are of an LPN with variance type Missing (a case where LPN is missing in the current location but the system shows it's existance in the current location), LPN will be moved from system location to the bin location associated with the variance acceptance reason code.
        • If the count result(s) is/are of an LPN with variance type New (a case where LPN found in the current location but the system shows it's existance in a different location), LPN will be moved to current location from the system location.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction ACCEPT_VARIANCE.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of acceptVariance.
            Data published - WMS_ACCEPT_VARIANCE.ON_SUCCESS.xml

          Audits: None

          Pre Conditions: None

          Post Conditions: None

          Output Template Support: Yes

          Database Extensibility Support: No

          Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains all audit records written after performing inventory adjustment. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
